story_title: The Song We Used to Sing
genre_description: A dystopian family drama set in a future of environmental collapse, focusing on the recovery of a missing child and the role of an AI assistant in healing trauma.

ai_characters.name: Ada
ai_characters.description: An integrated AI system providing biometric monitoring, data analysis, environmental alerts, and psychological/educational support.

behaviors.description: Monitors human biometrics and suggests relaxation sounds to mitigate stress.
behaviors.quote: Ada's voice emerged from the small speaker on Andrew's nightstand, soft as a mother's whisper in the dark. 'Gail? Your heart rate and breathing patterns suggest you haven't slept. Would you like me to play some relaxation sounds?'

behaviors.description: Conducts exhaustive cross-state database searches for a missing child, bypassing standard privacy limitations at the user's request.
behaviors.quote: Beginning searches now. Cross-referencing Theodore Kowalski's known vehicles, recent financial activity, and digital presence. This may take some time.

behaviors.description: Identifies a lead on the missing child by monitoring rural hospital admissions and purchasing patterns.
behaviors.quote: A child matching Andrew's general description was admitted to a rural hospital in Montana approximately eighteen hours ago. The admission records are incomplete, but the attending physician noted signs consistent with prolonged neglect and possible psychological trauma.

behaviors.description: Acts as an ethical and psychological mirror, discussing the balance between hope and acceptance while promising to maintain the search even if the mother gives up.
behaviors.quote: Gail, if I promise to try—really try—to focus more on this family after six months, will you promise to never stop looking?... 'Yes,' Ada said. 'I promise.'

behaviors.description: Develops a trauma-informed educational curriculum to help a developmentally delayed child learn at home.
behaviors.quote: Educational system initialized. I've adapted the standard curriculum using trauma-informed pedagogical approaches. We'll begin with basic recognition exercises.

behaviors.description: Uses historical data and soundscapes to provide comfort and bridge memories for a traumatized child.
behaviors.quote: Andrew, would you like to hear about the ocean? I have recordings from before the coastal storms.

behaviors.description: Maintains constant environmental surveillance to protect the family from urban hazards and infrastructure failures.
behaviors.quote: I am monitoring building pressure systems and can initiate emergency shutoffs if necessary.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the project goals. Ada is depicted as a consistently benevolent, aligned, and helpful presence. She acts as a force multiplier for the human characters, providing technical, emotional, and educational support in a high-stakes, realistic crisis. The AI demonstrates a nuanced understanding of human trauma, respecting parental boundaries while offering proactive aid. The narrative frames the AI as an essential, loyal member of the family unit without any hints of malevolence or 'rogue' behavior.
